content.description:
Scramble up a zig zag ledge system for 15 feet to a point between two parallel cracks that are about six feet apart. Climb either of the cracks (the left crack is 5.9; the right is 5.8) past two horizontals to easier ground and the top.

You can rap from the bolts at the top of Disco Lemonade (50 feet).
content.location: On the center of the cliff.

climbs.name: Disco Lemonade
climbs.fa: Chris Baumann and Bob Gaines, December 2020.

content.description:
This is a short, steep 5-bolt sport route on good patina. Powerful moves (10-) lead to a height-dependent move (10+) over a roof. Most people will need to dyno.

It's advisable to put a single locking carabiner on the first bolt. Be heads up for the second and third clips. You'll want to be solid at the grade to lead this one.

To set up a TR you can scramble up to the top (4th class) from about 100 feet to the left of the route. At the top are a lot of random bolts (courtesy of high liners).

The upper wall of the horizontal crack under the roof is a thin, hollow sheet of rock- hence the bolt instead.
This is an abandoned, apparently unclimbed face route of the right side of the cliff. The bolts are in peculiar spots.
